---Officer Report---IntroductionThis application is of a nature where the Council's Constitution delegates the authority to make the decision to Officers rather than it being decided by a Committee of Councillors.  Before preparing this summary report a Planning Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the relevant Development Plan policies and guidance, considered any relevant previous planning applications, and considered any comments made by those interested in the application such as consultees with specialist knowledge and nearby residents.This decision has been authorised by a Senior Officer (Authorising Officer) in the Development Management Service. Prior to endorsing the Planning Officer's recommendation, the Authorising Officer has familiarised themselves with the application site, the application documents, the relevant planning policies and guidance, any relevant history, and any representations received.The application is submitted under Section 192 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to ascertain whether the 'Use of a dwellinghouse for taxi booking operations for taxi company' would be lawful for planning purposes.The submitted application form sets the following details :1.The applicant wishes to run a private hire taxi business from home to take only online bookings and bookings over the phone2. No public access3. Operate from a small room at the home to run online booked taxis private hire business4. The proposed operation will be permanent5. The proposed development has startedBased on the information provided by the applicant (see above), the use described would not amount to a material change of use of part or whole of the house and therefore planning permission is not required.2. This Lawful Development Certificate has been granted based on the information submitted.  If visitor numbers and/ or activity increase to an extent not normally associated with the use of the  building  as a single dwellinghouse, express planning permission will be required to change the use of the building. No adverts should be displayed to undermine the primary use of the building as a family home and there should be no external alterations to the building that might change the character of the building away from that of a dwellinghouse .3. Details of the Application SubmissionIn accordance with the requirements of the Local Government Act 1972 details of the application submission were available on the Council's website during the assessment of the application
